alert.note: Alert for Barnes; Cass; Ransom; Richland; Sargent (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 08 at 2:22PM CST until November 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to three tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Barnes, Cass, Ransom, Sargent and Richland Counties. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be nearly impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice where freezing rain occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If freezing rain or sleet persists then snow totals may decrease. Uncertainty remains for the areas that could receive the heaviest snow and timing and coverage of freezing rain or sleet. This will create large spread in potential impacts, and the storm track could still shift.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
